business.headline: Want to earn 3–4x more? These 4 countries are actively hiring IndiansSkilled Indians are catching the world's attention. An expert says that Germany, Japan, Finland and Taiwan — are actively hiring Indian professionals and offering salaries up to three to four times higher than those in India.

Why are NRIs flocking to buy homes in India?The transformation of India's real estate ecosystem has further strengthened this trust of the NRIs. Over the past decade, reforms such as the RERA improved project transparency, digitisation of land records and professionalisation of developers have collectively boosted buyer confidence.

8th Pay Commission: Cabinet clears terms of reference. What does this mean?With the Cabinet approving the Terms of Reference for the 8th Central Pay Commission, the countdown begins for the next pay and pension revision that could reshape earnings for millions of central government employees and pensioners.

India's organised farmstay market set to touch Rs 63,000 crore by 2029As city life grows more chaotic and polluted, many urban Indians are finding peace in the countryside. The growing shift towards wellness and greener living is now driving India's organised farmstay market to new heights.

The billion-dollar goodbye: Why global tech giants are spending more to let people goIn this deep-dive on global tech layoffs, we analyse severance costs, project realignments, and slowing demand cycles to understand why companies are standardising leaner headcounts and shifting toward automation-driven operational efficiency.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly ahead of US Fed decision. Check latest ratesOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), Gold December futures were trading at Rs 1,19,755 per 10 grams at 9:43 am, up modestly from Tuesday's close. Silver December futures were quoted at Rs 1,44,768 per kg, also showing a slight uptick after recent losses.

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; US Fed decision in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 153.31 points higher at 84,781.47, while the NSE Nifty50 hovered just below the 26,000 level after briefly crossing it during early trade.

Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs amid company's AI push to slash costsAmazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs, its biggest layoffs since 2023, as it ramps up artificial intelligence investments and trims costs under CEO Andy Jassy's ongoing restructuring plan.

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.
Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cabinet clears terms of reference for 8th Pay CommissionInformation and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed that the government has finalised the commission's composition, mandate and timelines.

What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Peyush Bansal's Lenskart IPO opens on October 31. Here's all you need to knowPeyush Bansal-led Lenskart is set to hit the primary market on October 31 with its Rs 7,278 crore IPO. Backed by a strong brand presence and rapid expansion, the issue is among the most awaited listings of 2025.

6 hidden home loan traps your bank won't tell you. Expert shares smart hacksBuying your dream home can quickly turn stressful when hidden costs and surprise clauses appear. From processing fees to "mandatory" insurance, a tax expert shares six practical hacks every borrower should know before signing their home loan papers.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentSyam Krishna, a CRPF officer, was advised to hospitalise his autistic son when he fell ill. However, his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even raised questions on the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story delves into how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Why quitting SIPs within 3 years is a costly mistakeStarting an SIP is easy, staying invested isn't. An expert explains why most Indian investors quit too soon, and how this one mistake can cost them lakhs in the long run.

MCX glitch halts gold, silver futures trade; check latest updateIn a series of updates issued throughout the morning, MCX stated that the issue was being addressed and that trading would now commence from its Disaster Recovery (DR) site. However, the exchange did not specify a fresh start time.

entertainment.headline: Down Cemetery Road review: Ruth Wilson's suburban meltdown is deliciously twistedRelease Date:Wed Oct 29, 2025 Apple TV+ dropped the first two episodes of 'Down Cemetery Road' on October 29. With stellar turns by Ruth Wilson and Emma Thompson, this Oxford-set thriller promises an addictive ride for viewers.

Exclusive: BB19 producer on Salman Khan's Rs 150-crore salary buzz, alleged biases 'Bigg Boss 19' producer Rishi Negi opened up about long-standing allegations of Salman Khan's bias on the reality show, addressing whether the host is guided by the makers during weekend episodes. In an exclusive chat with India Today, Negi explains how Salman personally reviews footage, forms his own opinions, and collaborates with the team.

Juhi Chawla's daughter Jahnavi Mehta on IPL thrills and phuchka promises Jahnavi reveals she nurtured sporting dreams growing up and was never really drawn to the film industry despite being Juhi Chawla's daughter

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 51: Nominations heat up as Bharani and Srija make a comeback The week inside the 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' house turned intense as Bharani and Srija re-entered amid high anticipation.

Harshvardhan Rane hints another film with Milap Zaveri. Director responds After 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', actor Harshvardhan Rane is likely to collaborate with director Milap Zaveri again. The duo hinted at the upcoming project on social media.

Matthew Perry's sister says she still feels his presence: Maybe ghosts are real Nearly two years after Matthew Perry's death, his sister Caitlin Morrison shared that she still feels his presence and often hears his voice in daily moments.

Don Lee to face off with Prabhas in Sandeep Vanga's Spirit, reports Korean media Multiple Korean media outlets report Don Lee, known for 'Train to Busan' and 'Eternals', will take on a pivotal role in the Telugu film 'Spirit', directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga and starring Prabhas. The film is expected to be released in 2026, though official confirmation from the production team is pending.

Delhi High Court refuses to hear PIL urgently against Paresh Rawal's The Taj Story A petition was filed in the Delhi High Court challenging the release of the film 'The Taj Story', starring Paresh Rawal, amid concerns that it spreads fringe theories about the Taj Mahal's origins and may threaten communal harmony.

Manushi, Diljit break silence on Kufar controversy after viral leg-lift moment After Diljit Dosanjh, Manushi Chhillar addressed online trolling and defended a fellow dancer after a controversial scene from Diljit Dosanjh's video 'Kufar' drew attention on social media.

Shilpa Shinde to make comeback as Angoori Bhabhi in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai? Actor Shilpa Shinde is likely to make her return to 'Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai' nearly a decade after her controversial exit. Discussions are reportedly underway to replace Shubhangi Atre with Shilpa as Angoori Bhabhi.

Benny Blanco is making every month count with wife Selena Gomez Singer Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco got married on September 27 in Santa Barbara, and recently commemorated their first month as newlyweds with a private beach walk and intimate dinner, joined by close friends from the entertainment industry.

Why Courage the Cowardly Dog still feels like perfect Halloween comfort Revisiting 'Courage the Cowardly Dog' this Halloween proves that spooky doesn't always mean soulless. It's scary, weird, and full of heart, the perfect nostalgic comfort show.

Ibrahim Ali Khan reacts to constant comparisons with father Saif: It's a compliment Ibrahim Ali Khan opened up about being constantly compared to his father Saif Ali Khan, saying it motivates him to live up to his legacy. Despite a slow start with his first two films, the young actor remains determined as he gears up for his next project, 'Diler'.

Watch Aryan Khan hit pickleball court after The Ba***ds of Bollywood success Videos of Aryan Khan, son of Shah Rukh Khan, showcasing his pickleball skills have gone viral. He recently garnered praise for his directorial debut series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Naseeruddin Shah bids farewell to Satish Shah, blames Bollywood for typecasting him Veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah penned an emotional tribute to his late friend and 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro' co-star Satish Shah, recalling his warmth, humour, and brilliance. In his heartfelt note, Shah reflected on how Bollywood unfairly typecast Satish as a comedian despite his immense talent.

Mani Ratnam praises Bison, calls director Mari Selvaraj's voice important Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has praised Mari Selvaraj's film 'Bison Kaalamaadan', prompting a heartfelt response from the director. The film, which features Dhruv Vikram in the lead, was released on October 17 and is based on the story of kabaddi player Manathi Ganesan.

Worked 22 hours a day: Actor Hiten Tejwani opens up on tough TV schedules Hiten Tejwani sheds light on the exhausting work culture of Indian television, recalling sleepless nights and relentless schedules that shaped his rise from humble beginnings to one of the industry's most respected actors.

Siddharth calls Aditi Rao Hydari his greatest strength in poetic birthday post Siddharth celebrated Aditi Rao Hydari's birthday with a heartfelt poem on social media, expressing his deep love and gratitude for her.

general news.headline: PM Modi will dance for votes: Rahul Gandhi's no-holds-barred attack in BiharRahul Gandhi kicked off his Bihar poll campaign with a strong attack on PM Modi and Nitish Kumar. His remarks have set the tone for a fiercely contested election season in the state.

President poses with woman Rafale pilot Pakistan falsely claimed to have capturedPresident Droupadi Murmu's Rafale sortie came with a powerful image -- her standing beside Squadron Leader Shivangi Singh, the Rafale pilot Pakistan had falsely claimed was captured during Operation Sindoor.

Nicest looking guy: Trump praises PM Modi, repeats India-Pak ceasefire claimSpeaking at a luncheon in South Korea, US President Donald Trump praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi and again claimed he personally helped end fighting between India and Pakistan earlier this year.

Why Delhi's cloud-seeding trial for artificial rain was bound to failDelhi rain: The much-hyped cloud seeding experiment in Delhi on Tuesday to induce rainfall is yet to yield visible results. In reality, there was little chance of the experiment succeeding due to low moisture content.

Sridhar Vembu draws sharp rebuttal from doctors over unverified vaccine-autism linkA self-published report claims a link between vaccines and autism, strongly promoted by Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu. Doctors and public health experts warn this misinformation could harm decades of public health progress in India.

AUS vs IND, Live: Reduced match to resume at 3:00PMAUS vs IND, Live score 1st T20I: Captain Suryakumar Yadav has walked in at No. 3 after India lost Abhishek Sharma early. Nathan Ellis got the big wicket of the No. 1-ranked batter. However, India have gotten off to a solid start with Shubman Gill trying to break free from the other end.

Inside Masood Azhar's women's jihad brigade to counter Hindu womenMasood Azhar promised paradise to women who join Jamaat-ul-Mominat, portraying the unit as a counter to what he calls the use of women in armies and media by the "enemies of Jaish".

Is this Delhi's Lagaan moment? Does cloud-seeding always bring rain?Like the villagers of Champaner in Lagaan, Delhiites on Tuesday looked towards the sky with hope. But the clouds drifted away, and all that was left was toxic air. Was the cloud-seeding experiment, which cost crores, the Lagaan moment of the Delhi government? This is what cloud seeding does and its success rate.

Rohit Sharma becomes oldest-ever No. 1 ODI batter, replaces Shubman Gill at topRohit Sharma has made history by becoming the world's No.1 batter in the latest ICC ODI rankings at the age of 38. The Indian opener displaced teammate and ODI captain Shubman Gill to reclaim the top spot following a dominant performance in the three-match series against Australia.

Caught on CCTV: Lawrence Bishnoi gang kills Indian businessman in CanadaThe brazen daylight killing on a busy street has sent shockwaves through Abbotsford's South Asian community. Local authorities have begun a probe into the veracity of the gang's online claim, with Canadian police coordinating with Indian agencies for intelligence inputs.

Gurgaon CEO calls employee's breakup leave mail 'most honest request', approvesJasveer Singh, co-founder and CEO of Knot Dating, opined that "Gen Z doesn't do filters," suggesting that younger employees are increasingly upfront about their emotions and mental well-being.

Manushi, Diljit break silence on Kufar controversy after viral leg-lift momentAfter Diljit Dosanjh, Manushi Chhillar addressed online trolling and defended a fellow dancer after a controversial scene from Diljit Dosanjh's video 'Kufar' drew attention on social media.

I'm still a detainee: India-born man's new battle after 43 years in US JailSubramanyam Subu Vedam, an India-born man exonerated after 43 years in a US prison for a wrongful murder conviction, was immediately detained by ICE under a decades-old deportation order. Freed after new FBI evidence proved his innocence, 64-year-old Vedam now faces deportation to India, the country he left as a nine-month-old. Here's the story of the ordeal of the longest-serving wrongfully convicted person in Pennsylvania's history, and one of the longest in the US.

IISc's 80-hour rule sparks campus unrest, students call it oppressiveThe unrest at IISc began after the 80-hour work rule, sparking debate on whether India's growing push for productivity is coming at the cost of students' freedom to think and rest.

Khalistani outfit threatens Diljit Dosanjh for touching Amitabh Bachchan's feetThe banned Khalistani outfit has said that Diljit Dosanjh touching Amitabh Bachchan's feet was an insult to every victim of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots.
Before you try Gwyneth Paltrow's 'raw cream' coffee, read thisGwyneth Paltrow's coffee, topped with 'raw cream', might not be as desirable as it sounds. It could have repercussions, negative ones.

Conscious unbossing: Why 52% of Gen-Z employees don't want to be managersOver half of Gen Z employees are opting out of becoming managers in a workplace trend being termed "conscious unbossing". They prefer autonomy, lower stress and skills-driven roles. Employers need to rethink leadership paths or risk losing their future talent.
Mysterious lights glow in skies over Pakistan. It's not a missile launchResidents and early risers in Pakistan described the surreal scene, with unusual hues lighting up the sky.

Gujarat woman plots husband's murder with lover to start new life togetherA brutal murder case in Bhavnagar has shocked the local community after a labourer was found dead with severe injuries. Police arrested the wife, her lover, and his friend who confessed to conspiring and killing the husband to be together.

Will break their legs: Bengal Minister warns BJP, poll body as SIR spurs CAA fearsEchoing Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, who dubbed the poll roll revision a "backdoor NRC", Bengal Minister Firhad Hakim raised the suicide of a man who blamed the controversial exercise for his death.

Watch: Ruturaj shares Ranji Trophy award with double centurion Prithvi ShawRuturaj Gaikwad shared his Player of the Match award with Prithvi Shaw after Maharashtra's Ranji Trophy win over Chandigarh. Shaw's explosive double century played a decisive role in his team's 144-run victory.

Shreyas Iyer Injury Scare: Cricketer Suffers Lacerated Spleen, Internal BleedingThis special report focuses on the critical injury sustained by Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer during the third ODI against Australia in Sydney. The BCCI confirmed the extent of the injury in a press release. According to the board, 'Shreyas Iyer sustained a blunt injury to his abdomen, resulting in a laceration of his spleen with internal bleeding on 25th October during the third ODI against Australia'. The injury, which occurred while taking a catch, was promptly identified and the bleeding was arrested, leading to his condition stabilising. Now out of the ICU, Iyer remains under the close observation of the BCCI's medical team in consultation with specialists in Sydney and India, with scans showing significant improvement on his road to recovery.

Babar Azam flops as South Africa crush Pakistan by 55 runs in RawalpindiPAK vs SA: South Africa crushed Pakistan by 55 runs in the first T20I at Rawalpindi, with George Linde starring in an all-round show. Babar Azam's return ended in disappointment as he fell for a duck, deepening Pakistan's batting woes.

Fans criticised the comparisons with Virat Kohli, saying Babar should not be measured against a player of Kohli's class and calibre.

South Africa were bundled out for 69 by England in the game.

Shardul Thakur eyes India return, aims to seal No.8 spot 2027 World CupShardul Thakur has said that he is eyeing an Indian comeback and wants to be part of the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Shardul was part of the India squad for the England tour and is currently the skipper of the Mumbai team.

How Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav inspired Shreyanka Patil amid injury layoffShreyanka Patil opened up about her injury struggles and how Jasprit Bumrah and Suryakumar Yadav inspired her to stay positive and focused during her year-long layoff. The off-spinner, who missed the WPL season, is now playing in the Senior Women's T20 Trophy.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
